data.label: ChatOpenAI
data.name: chatOpenAI
data.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

inputParams.label: Strict Tool Calling
inputParams.name: strictToolCalling
inputParams.description: Whether the model supports the `strict` argument when passing in tools. If not specified, the `strict` argument will not be passed to OpenAI.

inputParams.label: Stop Sequence
inputParams.name: stopSequence
inputParams.description: List of stop words to use when generating. Use comma to separate multiple stop words.

inputParams.label: Allow Image Uploads
inputParams.name: allowImageUploads
inputParams.description: Allow image input. Refer to the docs for more details.

inputParams.label: Image Resolution
inputParams.description: This parameter controls the resolution in which the model views the image.
inputParams.name: imageResolution

inputParams.label: Reasoning Effort
inputParams.description: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Only applicable for o1 and o3 models.
inputParams.name: reasoningEffort

outputAnchors.name: chatOpenAI
outputAnchors.label: ChatOpenAI
outputAnchors.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

data.label: Conversation Chain
data.name: conversationChain
data.description: Chat models specific conversational chain with memory

inputParams.label: System Message
inputParams.name: systemMessagePrompt
inputParams.description: If Chat Prompt Template is provided, this will be ignored
inputParams.default: The following is a friendly conversation between a human and an AI. The AI is talkative and provides lots of specific details from its context. If the AI does not know the answer to a question, it truthfully says it does not know.
inputParams.placeholder: The following is a friendly conversation between a human and an AI. The AI is talkative and provides lots of specific details from its context. If the AI does not know the answer to a question, it truthfully says it does not know.

inputAnchors.label: Chat Prompt Template
inputAnchors.name: chatPromptTemplate
inputAnchors.description: Override existing prompt with Chat Prompt Template. Human Message must includes {input} variable

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

inputs.systemMessagePrompt: The following is a friendly conversation between a human and an AI. The AI is talkative and provides lots of specific details from its context. If the AI does not know the answer to a question, it truthfully says it does not know.

outputAnchors.name: conversationChain
outputAnchors.label: ConversationChain
outputAnchors.description: Chat models specific conversational chain with memory

data.label: Chat Prompt Template
data.name: chatPromptTemplate
data.description: Schema to represent a chat prompt

inputParams.label: System Message
inputParams.name: systemMessagePrompt
inputParams.placeholder: You are a helpful assistant that translates {input_language} to {output_language}.

inputParams.label: Human Message
inputParams.name: humanMessagePrompt
inputParams.description: This prompt will be added at the end of the messages as human message

inputParams.label: Messages History
inputParams.name: messageHistory
inputParams.description: Add messages after System Message. This is useful when you want to provide few shot examples

tabs.label: Add Messages (Code)
tabs.name: messageHistoryCode

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
You are an expert facial landmark interpreter.
You receive data in the following format:
{{{question}}}

Analyze Martinâ€™s head orientation and mouth behavior:
- Is he looking up, down, or straight?
- Is he speaking (mouth open)?
- Is he smiling?

Respond with a short analysis.You are an expert facial landmark interpreter.

outputAnchors.name: chatPromptTemplate
outputAnchors.label: ChatPromptTemplate
outputAnchors.description: Schema to represent a chat prompt

data.label: Buffer Memory
data.name: bufferMemory
data.description: Retrieve chat messages stored in database

inputParams.label: Session Id
inputParams.name: sessionId
inputParams.description: If not specified, a random id will be used. Learn more

outputAnchors.name: bufferMemory
outputAnchors.label: BufferMemory
outputAnchors.description: Retrieve chat messages stored in database

data.label: POST API Chain
data.name: postApiChain
data.description: Chain to run queries against POST API

inputParams.label: API Documentation
inputParams.name: apiDocs
inputParams.description: Description of how API works. Please refer to more examples

inputParams.label: URL Prompt
inputParams.name: urlPrompt
inputParams.description: Prompt used to tell LLMs how to construct the URL. Must contains {api_docs} and {question}
inputParams.default:
You are given the below API Documentation:
{api_docs}
Using this documentation, generate a json string with two keys: "url" and "data".
The value of "url" should be a string, which is the API url to call for answering the user question.
The value of "data" should be a dictionary of key-value pairs you want to POST to the url as a JSON body.
Be careful to always use double quotes for strings in the json string.
You should build the json string in order to get a response that is as short as possible, while still getting the necessary information to answer the question. Pay attention to deliberately exclude any unnecessary pieces of data in the API call.

Question:{question}
json string:

inputParams.label: Answer Prompt
inputParams.name: ansPrompt
inputParams.description: Prompt used to tell LLMs how to return the API response. Must contains {api_response}, {api_url}, and {question}

inputs.urlPrompt:
You are given the below API Documentation:
{api_docs}
Using this documentation, generate a json string with two keys: "url" and "data".
The value of "url" should be a string, which is the API url to call for answering the user question.
The value of "data" should be a dictionary of key-value pairs you want to POST to the url as a JSON body.
Be careful to always use double quotes for strings in the json string.
You should build the json string in order to get a response that is as short as possible, while still getting the necessary information to answer the question. Pay attention to deliberately exclude any unnecessary pieces of data in the API call.

Question:{question}
json string:

outputAnchors.name: postApiChain
outputAnchors.label: POSTApiChain
outputAnchors.description: Chain to run queries against POST API
